OOC: It all sounds good, but I think we could try something else. What 
do you think of playing on a colony instead of Cybertron. Cybertron 
seems all good and everything, but there are some general guidelines 
we'd have to follow. On some colony world, we'd get to create the 
world we want to play on.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Vincent Price" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Well, then, I give it a fair chance. I reacted that way I think 
because I'm still upset about the death of NBMSSO. But then again, 
it's death may have brought for the life of DBZSF, since it made me 
spend more time on it. I'm still actually one of the only ones in the 
RPG who prefers to do more talking than fighting, like what goes on in 
DBZSF. I say, whatever comes around in this RPG, comes around, I don't 
fear the future...
> 
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: KSLawdogg@c... 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 3:29 PM
>   Subject: Re: Debate (important everyone read)
> 
> 
>   (I beg to differ.  I'm in a MUSH, that takes place solely on 
Cybertron.  And 
>   it is way better than the NBW.  Cybertron would just require lots 
of 
>   thinking.  Like the millions if not billions of civilians that 
would be on 
>   the planet, and since all we do in this RPG is fight we'd have to 
take that 
>   into account.
> 
>   Because most factions in the NBW have, if they're big, 20 
characters, and 20 
>   characters would mean jack crap compared to a population of 
millions or 
>   billions.)
> 
>
